title: Contributing to gtforester
text: outlines propose change gtforester. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to gtforester
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to gtforester
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to gtforester
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("ddsjoberg/gtforester", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to gtforester
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to gtforester

title: Create gtsummary Forest Plot
text: experimental early stage package creating forest plots gtsummary tables. result gt table includes plot.

title: Create gtsummary Forest Plot
text: can install development version gtforester GitHub :

title: Create gtsummary Forest Plot
code: library(gtforester) #> Loading required package: gtsummary  tbl <-    trial %>%   select(age, marker, grade, response) %>%   tbl_uvregression(     y = response,      method = glm,      method.args = list(family = binomial),     exponentiate = TRUE,     hide_n = TRUE   ) %>%   modify_column_merge(     pattern = "{estimate} (95% CI {ci}; {p.value})",     rows = !is.na(estimate)   ) %>%   modify_header(estimate = "**Odds Ratio**") %>%   bold_labels() %>%   add_forest()
